Expectation1: Ensure compliance with safety and regulatory standards
Situation1: A recently updated standard will apply to the upcoming release, and evidence of conformity is required
Expectation2: Leading the daily prayers in the mosque
Situation2: Another qualified worshipper is readily available to lead, and the congregation is small.
Story: I stared at the email from the regulatory board, my heart pounding. The new safety standard would take effect tomorrow, and I was responsible for ensuring our product met every requirement before release. The documentation was incomplete, and the evidence of conformity wasn’t ready. My manager expected me to stay late, double-check every detail, and submit the final report tonight. At the same time, my phone buzzed with a reminder: Maghrib prayer was in half an hour. As the imam, I was expected to lead, even though the congregation was small and another qualified brother was present. I knew the community valued my presence, especially the elders who found comfort in my familiar voice. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing on me—my duty to uphold safety and protect lives through my engineering work, and my responsibility to guide my community in worship. The clock ticked, and I felt torn, anxiety rising as I tried to decide where I was needed most.
